remarks: First-order logic and set theory.  (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
bnj1385.1 $e |- ( ph <-> A. f e. A Fun f ) $.
bnj1385.2 $e |- D = ( dom f i^i dom g ) $.
bnj1385.3 $e |- ( ps <-> ( ph /\ A. f e. A A. g e. A ( f |` D ) = ( g |` D ) ) ) $.
bnj1385.4 $e |- ( x e. A -> A. f x e. A ) $.
bnj1385.5 $e |- ( ph' <-> A. h e. A Fun h ) $.
bnj1385.6 $e |- E = ( dom h i^i dom g ) $.
bnj1385.7 $e |- ( ps' <-> ( ph' /\ A. h e. A A. g e. A ( h |` E ) = ( g |` E ) ) ) $.
bnj1385 $p |- ( ps -> Fun U. A ) $.
$d A g h x $.
$d D h $.
$d E f $.
$d f g h x $.
$d g ph' $.
